sections.heading: What is どう (dou)?
sections.content:
どう means "how" in Japanese. It's used to ask about:

Method/manner (how to do something) Opinion (what do you think) Condition/state (how is it)

どうですか？ "How is it?" どうやって行きますか？ "How do you go?" どう思いますか？ "What do you think?"

children.heading: どうですか？
children.content:
Asking for opinion or condition:

日本語はどうですか？ "How is your Japanese?" 天気はどうですか？ "How's the weather?" 仕事はどうですか？ "How's work?" これはどうですか？ "How about this?"

children.heading: どうやって (dou yatte) - "How to"
children.content:
Asking about method:

どうやって行きますか？ "How do you go?" どうやって作りますか？ "How do you make it?" どうやって勉強しますか？ "How do you study?" どうやって日本語を覚えましたか？ "How did you learn Japanese?"

children.heading: どう思う (dou omou) - "What do you think"
children.content: どう思いますか？ "What do you think?" これについてどう思う？ "What do you think about this?" 彼についてどう思いますか？ "What do you think about him?"

children.heading: どうする (dou suru) - "What will you do"
children.content: どうする？ "What will you do?" どうしますか？ "What will you do?" これからどうしますか？ "What will you do from now?" 週末どうする？ "What will you do on the weekend?"

children.heading: どうした (doushita) - "What happened/What's wrong"
children.content: どうした？ "What's wrong? / What happened?" どうしたの？ "What's wrong?" どうしたんですか？ "What happened?"

children.heading: どうやって + Verb
children.content: どうやって来ましたか？ "How did you come?" どうやって料理しますか？ "How do you cook?" どうやって覚えますか？ "How do you memorize?"

children.heading: どのように (dono you ni) - Formal "how"
children.content:
More formal version:

どのようにしますか？ "How will you do it?" どのように考えますか？ "How do you think?" どのように進めますか？ "How will you proceed?"

children.heading: About Things
children.content: この本はどうですか？ "How is this book?" 日本はどうですか？ "How is Japan?" 料理はどうでしたか？ "How was the food?"

children.heading: About Actions
children.content: 映画を見るのはどうですか？ "How about watching a movie?" 明日会うのはどう？ "How about meeting tomorrow?" コーヒーを飲むのはどうですか？ "How about drinking coffee?"

sections.heading: Common Responses to どう Questions

children.heading: Positive
children.content: いいですね "That's good" いいと思います "I think it's good" 賛成です "I agree"

children.heading: Negative
children.content: ちょっと... "Well... (hesitant)" あまり良くないです "Not very good" 反対です "I oppose"

children.heading: Neutral
children.content: まあまあです "So-so" 普通です "Normal/average" どちらでもいいです "Either is fine"

children.heading: どうも (doumo)
children.content:
Multiple meanings depending on context:

どうもありがとう "Thank you very much" どうも "Hello/Thanks" (casual) どうもすみません "I'm very sorry"

children.heading: どうしても (doushitemo)
children.content:
"No matter what/by all means":

どうしても行きたい "I want to go no matter what" どうしてもわからない "I can't understand no matter what" どうしても必要だ "It's absolutely necessary"

children.heading: どうせ (douse)
children.content:
"Anyway/in any case" (often negative nuance):

どうせ無理だ "It's impossible anyway" どうせ誰も来ない "Nobody will come anyway"

children.heading: どうか (douka)
children.content:
"Please/somehow":

どうか助けてください "Please help me" どうかよろしくお願いします "Please (treat me favorably)"

children.heading: Example 1: Opinion
children.content: A: この映画、どうですか？ "How is this movie?" B: とてもいいですよ "It's very good" A: 面白いですか？ "Is it interesting?" B: はい、とても面白いです "Yes, it's very interesting"

children.heading: Example 2: Method
children.content: A: どうやって日本語を勉強しますか？ "How do you study Japanese?" B: アプリを使います "I use apps" A: どのアプリですか？ "Which app?" B: Duolingoです "It's Duolingo"

children.heading: Example 3: Concern
children.content: A: どうしたの？ "What's wrong?" B: 頭が痛い "I have a headache" A: 大丈夫？ "Are you okay?" B: うん、ありがとう "Yeah, thanks"

children.heading: Example 4: Suggestion
children.content: A: 週末どうする？ "What will you do on the weekend?" B: わからない。映画はどう？ "I don't know. How about a movie?" A: いいね！ "Sounds good!"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Confusing どう with other question words
children.content: どう - how (method/opinion) 何 - what (thing) 誰 - who (person) どこ - where (place) Wrong context: どう食べますか？ (when asking "what") ❌ Right: 何を食べますか？ ✓ "What will you eat?"

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using どう without context
children.content: Unclear: どうですか？ (needs context) Clear: 日本語はどうですか？ ✓ "How is your Japanese?"

children.heading: Casual
children.content: どう？ "How?" どうする？ "What will you do?" どうだった？ "How was it?"

children.heading: Polite
children.content: どうですか？ "How is it?" どうしますか？ "What will you do?" どうでしたか？ "How was it?"

children.heading: Formal
children.content: どのようにしますか？ "How will you do it?" いかがですか？ "How is it?" (formal)

sections.heading: いかが (ikaga) - Formal "How"
sections.content:
More polite/formal version of どう:

お茶はいかがですか？ "How about some tea?" お仕事はいかがですか？ "How is your work?" ご気分はいかがですか？ "How are you feeling?"

children.heading: Basic Questions
children.content: どうですか？ "How is it?" どう思いますか？ "What do you think?" どうしますか？ "What will you do?" どうしたの？ "What's wrong?"

children.heading: Method
children.content: どうやって行きますか？ "How do you go?" どうやって作りますか？ "How do you make it?" どうやって勉強しますか？ "How do you study?"

children.heading: Opinion
children.content: 日本語はどうですか？ "How is your Japanese?" 映画はどうでしたか？ "How was the movie?" この本はどうですか？ "How is this book?"

children.heading: Suggestions
children.content: 明日会うのはどう？ "How about meeting tomorrow?" コーヒーを飲むのはどうですか？ "How about drinking coffee?"

children.heading: Special Expressions
children.content: どうもありがとう "Thank you very much" どうしても行きたい "I want to go no matter what" どうか助けてください "Please help me"

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: Question Words (5W1H) - Overview どうやって - How to (method) どのように - How (formal) いかが - How (polite) と思う - I think Asking opinions - Opinion expressions
